settings.ddp_heading: Resolving parental conflict and reducing family stress: how to nurture harmony for happier children

settings.title: Introduction
settings.subtitle: Most of us can relate to the unease and discomfort that arise from conflicts within our families.
settings.description: Whether it's heated arguments with our partners or clashes with (or between) our children, these moments of tension can leave everyone feeling on edge and unhappy.
settings.desc_1: During moments of conflict, it's crucial to remain calm and composed. Take a deep breath, step back, and give yourself a moment to collect your thoughts. Reacting impulsively may escalate the situation further.
settings.title_2: Choose the Right Time and Place
settings.desc_2: Timing is essential when addressing conflicts. Find a suitable moment when all parties involved are calm and receptive. Ensure privacy and create a safe space for open dialogue.
settings.desc_3: Put yourself in the other person's shoes to better understand their perspective. Cultivating empathy allows for better communication and a deeper connection with your family members.

settings.description: Inter-parental conflict can have significant consequences, especially on children who are sensitive to the emotional atmosphere around them. Frequent and unresolved conflicts can lead to heightened stress levels, anxiety, and a sense of insecurity in children.

settings.title: Identifying the root causes
settings.subtitle: Conflicts within the family often stem from a combination of factors, including miscommunication, unmet expectations, differing parenting styles, and external stressors.
settings.description: It's essential to identify these underlying causes to address conflicts effectively. By recognising patterns and triggers, we can begin to find solutions that promote understanding and compromise.
